docstr: `DBLE` — Double conversion function ### Description `DBLE(A)` Converts `A` to double precision real type. ### Syntax `RESULT = DBLE(A)` ### Arguments , or `COMPLEX`. ### Return value The return value is of type double precision real. ### Example ``` program test_dble     real :: x = 2.18     integer :: i = 5     complex :: z = (2.3,1.14)     print *, dble(x), dble(i), dble(z) end program test_dble ``` ### Standard Fortran 77 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also REAL
